page.title: 05FARMING FAIRLIGHT, E. SUSSEX
page.content:
There are 21 farms in Fairlight, parts of Guestling and Pett, East Sussex. They are family farms of between 120 and 170 acres.
The main farming activity is sheep rearing. The secondary activity is growing cereals, mainly oats with some barley and wheat. More oats are grown here than any other part of Sussex, or perhaps more than any other part of the south-east. Some of the farms also grow one or two vegetables and early potatoes.
One farm has four Charolais cows. A few of the farms have calves for fattening but there are no dairy farms here. Several of the farms have two or three ponies for the family to ride. A livestock market is held nearby in Rye.
